summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL Supervisor Rounds log for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering rounds on August 9-10, 2019. It documents routine security checks, including checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a 'SUICIDE RM', in the days immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds - Day 1
events.description: Multiple rounds of security checks conducted by lieutenants at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, throughout the day and evening, including checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and other areas.

events.title: Prison Supervisor Rounds - Day 2
events.description: Continued rounds of security checks by lieutenants, including morning, day, and evening watches. Logs show checks of a 'SUICIDE RM' and the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York)
keyFacts: The document is a Bureau of Prisons security log for August 9-10, 2019, the two days immediately before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
The log shows routine supervisor rounds were conducted, including checks of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a room designated 'SUICIDE RM'.
The rounds were conducted by lieutenants on morning, day, and evening watches, with entries marked 'Yes' for PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) compliance.
The log itself does not mention Jeffrey Epstein by name, but its date and location (MCC New York SHU) are directly relevant to the timeline of his death.
